cards.name: Lord of Atlantis
cards.text: Other Merfolk get +1/+1 and have islandwalk. (They can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)
cards.flavor: A master of tactics, the Lord of Atlantis makes his people bold in battle merely by arriving to lead them.
cards.originalText: All Merfolk in play gain islandwalk and +1/+1 while this card is in play.

cards.name: Magical Hack
cards.text: Change the text of target spell or permanent by replacing all instances of one basic land type with another. (For example, you may change "swampwalk" to "plainswalk." This effect lasts indefinitely.)

rulings.text: Alters all occurrences of the chosen word in the text box and the type line of the given card.
Can target a card with no appropriate words on it, or even one with no words at all.
It can’t change a word to the same word. It must be a different word.
It only changes what is printed on the card (or set on a token when it was created or set by a copy effect). It will not change any effects that are on the permanent.
You choose the words to change on resolution.
You can’t change proper nouns (i.e. card names) such as “Island Fish Jasconius”.

Changing the text of a spell will not allow you to change the targets of the spell because the targets were chosen when the spell was cast. The text change will (probably) cause it to be countered since the targets will be illegal.
If you change the text of a spell which is to become a permanent, the permanent will retain the text change until the effect wears off.
It can be used to change a land’s type from one basic land type to another. For example, Forest can be changed to Island so it produces blue mana. It doesn’t change the name of any permanent.

cards.originalText: Change the text of any card being played or already in play by replacing one basic land type with another. For example, you can change "swampwalk" to "plainswalk."

cards.name: Mahamoti Djinn
cards.text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
cards.flavor: Of royal blood among the spirits of the air, the Mahamoti Djinn rides on the wings of the winds. As dangerous in the gambling hall as he is in battle, he is a master of trickery and misdirection.
cards.originalText: Flying

cards.name: Mana Short
cards.text: Tap all lands target player controls and that player loses all unspent mana.

rulings.text: It even taps lands that do not produce mana.

Since this is an instant, your opponent may use instants in response to the casting of this spell. Note that such spells and abilities will be resolved before the mana pool is emptied by the Mana Short. This makes it useless as a countermeasure for spells. To use it effectively, you need to use it during Upkeep and even then it will not prevent the use of instant spells and abilities.
If you play Mana Short in response to a spell, it will have no effect on that spell since the mana has already been paid.

cards.originalText: All opponent's lands are tapped, and opponent's mana pool is emptied. Opponent takes no damage from unspent mana.

cards.name: Merfolk of the Pearl Trident
cards.flavor: Most human scholars believe that Merfolk are the survivors of sunken Atlantis, humans adapted to the water. Merfolk, however, believe that humans sprang forth from Merfolk who adapted themselves in order to explore their last frontier.

cards.name: Phantasmal Forces
cards.text:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Phantasmal Forces unless you pay {U}.
cards.flavor: These beings embody the essence of true heroes long dead. Summoned from the dreamrealms, they rise to meet their enemies.
cards.originalText:
Flying
Controller must spend oU during upkeep to maintain or Phantasmal Forces are destroyed.

cards.name: Phantasmal Terrain
cards.text:
Enchant land
As Phantasmal Terrain enters the battlefield, choose a basic land type.
Enchanted land is the chosen type.

rulings.text: Will not add or remove Snow Supertype to or from a land.

cards.originalText: Target land changes to any basic land type of caster's choice. Land type is set when cast and may not be further altered by this enchantment.

cards.name: Phantom Monster
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor:
"While, like a ghastly rapid river, Through the pale door, A hideous throng rush out forever, And laugh—but smile no more."
—Edgar Allan Poe, *"The Haunted Palace"*
cards.originalText: Flying

cards.name: Pirate Ship
cards.text:
Pirate Ship can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.
{T}: Pirate Ship deals 1 damage to any target.
When you control no Islands, sacrifice Pirate Ship.
cards.originalText: Tap to do 1 damage to any target. Cannot attack unless opponent has islands in play, though controller may still tap. Pirate Ship is destroyed immediately if at any time controller has no islands in play.

cards.name: Power Leak
cards.text:
Enchant enchantment
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted enchantment's controller, that player may pay any amount of mana. Power Leak deals 2 damage to that player. Prevent X of that damage, where X is the amount of mana that player paid this way.
cards.originalText: Target enchantment costs 2 extra mana each turn during upkeep. If target enchantment's controller cannot or will not pay this extra mana, Power Leak does 1 damage to him or her for each unpaid mana.

cards.name: Power Sink
cards.text: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {X}. If that player doesn't, they tap all lands with mana abilities they control and lose all unspent mana.

rulings.text: Does not increase the mana cost of the spell. It just requires a separate expenditure in order for it to succeed.

When this spell resolves, you either pay X mana or let your lands become tapped. The lands that become tapped are not “tapped for mana”. If you choose to pay, you may pay the X mana using whatever mana abilities you want to use.

Only lands that actually have mana abilities will get tapped. This includes basic lands and lands with mana abilities printed on them, as well as lands which have been granted a mana ability by some effect.

cards.originalText: Target spell is countered unless its caster spends X more mana; caster of target spell can't choose to let it be countered. If caster of target spell doesn't have enough mana, all available mana from lands and mana pool must be paid but target spell will still be countered.

cards.name: Prodigal Sorcerer
cards.text: {T}: Prodigal Sorcerer deals 1 damage to any target.
cards.flavor: Occasionally a member of the Institute of Arcane Study acquires a taste for worldly pleasures. Seldom do they have trouble finding employment.
cards.originalText: Tap to do 1 damage to any target.

cards.name: Psionic Blast
cards.text: Psionic Blast deals 4 damage to any target and 2 damage to you.
cards.originalText: Psionic Blast does 4 damage to any target, but it does 2 damage to you as well.

cards.name: Psychic Venom
cards.text:
Enchant land
Whenever enchanted land becomes tapped, Psychic Venom deals 2 damage to that land's controller.

rulings.text: Whenever the land is tapped for any reason, the ability triggers.

cards.originalText: Whenever target land is tapped, Psychic Venom does 2 damage to target land's controller.

cards.name: Sea Serpent
cards.text:
Sea Serpent can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.
When you control no Islands, sacrifice Sea Serpent.
cards.flavor: Legend has it that Serpents used to be bigger, but how could that be?
cards.originalText: Serpent cannot attack unless opponent has islands in play. Serpent is destroyed immediately if at any time controller has no islands in play.

cards.name: Siren's Call
cards.text:
Cast this spell only during an opponent's turn, before attackers are declared.
Creatures the active player controls attack this turn if able.
At the beginning of the next end step, destroy all non-Wall creatures that player controls that didn't attack this turn. Ignore this effect for each creature the player didn't control continuously since the beginning of the turn.

rulings.text: It will require creatures with Haste to attack since they are able, but it won’t destroy them if they don’t for some reason.
The creature is destroyed if it does not attack because it simply can’t do so legally.
This will destroy creatures that weren’t able to attack because they had been previously tapped.
If a turn has multiple combat phases, this spell can only be cast before the beginning of the Declare Attackers Step of the first combat phase in that turn.

cards.originalText: All of opponent's creatures that can attack must do so. Any non-wall creatures that cannot attack are destroyed at end of turn. Play only during opponent's turn, before opponent's attack. Creatures summoned this turn are unaffected by Siren's Call.

cards.name: Sleight of Mind
cards.text: Change the text of target spell or permanent by replacing all instances of one color word with another. (For example, you may change "target black spell" to "target blue spell." This effect lasts indefinitely.)

rulings.text: You can’t Sleight proper nouns (i.e. card names). This means that you can’t affect a “Black Vise”.
Can target a card with no color words on it.
Can’t change a color word to the same color word. It must be a different word.
Alters all occurrences of the chosen word in the text box and the type line of the given card.
Can target a card with no appropriate words on it, or even one with no words at all.
It can’t change a word to the same word. It must be a different word.
It only changes what is printed on the card (or set on a token when it was created or set by a copy effect). It will not change any effects that are on the permanent.
You choose the words to change on resolution.

Changing the text of a spell will not allow you to change the targets of the spell because the targets were chosen when the spell was cast. The text change will (probably) cause it to be countered since the targets will be illegal.
If you change the text of a spell which is to become a permanent, the permanent will retain the text change until the effect wears off.

cards.originalText: Change the text of any card being played or already in play by replacing one color word with another. For example, you can change "Counters red spells" to "Counters black spells." Cannot change mana symbols.

cards.name: Spell Blast
cards.text: Counter target spell with converted mana cost X. (For example, if that spell's mana cost is {3}{U}{U}, X is 5.)

rulings.text: Alternative costs, additional costs, cost increases, and cost reductions don’t affect a spell’s converted mana cost.

If the target spell has {X} in its mana cost, include the value chosen for that X when determining the value of the {X} in Spell Blast’s mana cost. For example, if you wish to counter Volcanic Geyser (a spell with mana cost {X}{R}{R}) whose X is 7, you’ll need to choose 9 for Spell Blast’s X and pay {9}{U}.

cards.originalText: Target spell is countered; X is cost of target spell.

cards.name: Stasis
cards.text:
Players skip their untap steps.
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Stasis unless you pay {U}.

rulings.text: Since there is no untap step, Phasing in/out won’t happen.
Does not prevent cards from being untapped outside the untap step.

cards.originalText: Players do not get an untap phase. Pay oU during your upkeep or Stasis is destroyed.

cards.name: Steal Artifact
cards.text:
Enchant artifact
You control enchanted artifact.

rulings.text: Can be used on artifact creatures.

cards.originalText: You control target artifact until enchantment is discarded or game ends. If target artifact was tapped when stolen, it stays tapped until you can untap it. If destroyed, target artifact is put in its owner's graveyard.

cards.name: Thoughtlace
cards.text: Target spell or permanent becomes blue. (Mana symbols on that permanent remain unchanged.)
cards.originalText: Changes the color of one card either being played or already in play to blue. Cost to cast, tap, maintain, or use a special ability of target card remains entirely unchanged.

cards.name: Time Walk
cards.text: Take an extra turn after this one.

rulings.text: If multiple “extra turn” effects resolve in the same turn, take them in the reverse of the order that the effects resolved.

cards.originalText: Take an extra turn after this one.

cards.name: Timetwister
cards.text: Each player shuffles their hand and graveyard into their library, then draws seven cards. (Then put Timetwister into its owner's graveyard.)

rulings.text: This card won’t be put into your graveyard until after it’s finished resolving, which means it won’t be shuffled into your library as part of its own effect.

cards.originalText: Set Timetwister aside in a new graveyard pile. Shuffle your hand, library, and graveyard together into a new library and draw a new hand of seven cards, leaving all cards in play where they are; opponent must do the same.

cards.name: Twiddle
cards.text: You may tap or untap target artifact, creature, or land.

rulings.text: This is not a toggle effect. If you use Twiddle to tap a card and before it takes effect your opponent taps it, Twiddle will not automatically untap the card.
The decision whether or not to tap or untap is made on resolution. This is not a modal spell.

cards.originalText: Caster may tap or untap any one land, creature, or artifact in play. No effects are generated by the target card.

cards.name: Unsummon
cards.text: Return target creature to its owner's hand.
cards.originalText: Return creature to owner's hand; enchantments on creature are discarded. Unsummon cannot be played during the damage-dealing phase of an attack.

cards.name: Vesuvan Doppelganger
cards.text: You may have Vesuvan Doppelganger enter the battlefield as a copy of any creature on the battlefield, except it doesn't copy that creature's color and it has "At the beginning of your upkeep, you may have this creature become a copy of target creature, except it doesn't copy that creature's color and it has this ability."

rulings.text: When the Doppelganger switches creatures, the creature it used to be is not considered to have left the battlefield. Such effects will consider the creature to have left the battlefield when the Doppelganger leaves the battlefield.
Damage is not removed when it changes forms.
Can switch to the same creature it is currently a copy of.
When it takes on the characteristics of the other card, it is no longer of creature type Shapeshifter.
When changing forms, any text changes that exist on the Doppelganger are applied to the new text, if appropriate.

If a Doppelganger is flipped, and it copies a flip card in any state, it will copy both “sides” of that card but use the flipped side. If a Doppelganger is unflipped, and it copies a flip card in any state, it will copy both “sides” of that card but use the unflipped side. In the second case, if it ever meets the flip conditions of its new ability, it will flip and used the flipped side of what it is copying.
Although Vesuvan Doppelganger’s triggered ability is targeted, its “as enters the battlefield” ability is not.
When Vesuvan Doppelganger’s triggered ability triggers, you must choose a target for it. You determine whether to have the Doppelganger become a copy of that target when the ability resolves.
Vesuvan Doppelganger copies the mana cost of the creature it’s copying but doesn’t copy its color.

If another creature copies Vesuvan Doppelganger, the new creature will become a copy of whatever Vesuvan Doppelganger is copying except for its color, will copy Vesuvan Doppelganger’s color, and will gain Vesuvan Doppelganger’s triggered ability.

Vesuvan Doppelganger’s triggered ability may cause it to become a copy of itself. A Vesuvan Doppelganger that becomes a copy of a Vesuvan Doppelganger (either itself or a different one) will gain another instance of its triggered ability. Each instance of that ability will trigger during its controller’s upkeep. They’ll all be put on the stack and resolve one at a time. The last one to resolve determines the Doppelganger’s characteristics for the rest of the turn.
Vesuvan Doppelganger copies a face-down creature, it becomes a face-up 2/2 blue creature with no name and no abilities other than the one it gives itself.

cards.originalText: Upon summoning, Doppelganger acquires all normal characteristics (except color) of any one creature in play on either side; any enchantments on the original creature are not copied. During controller's upkeep, Doppelganger may take on the characteristics of a different creature in play instead. Doppleganger may continue to copy a creature even after that creature leaves play, but if it switches it won't be able to switch back.

cards.name: Volcanic Eruption
cards.text: Destroy X target Mountains. Volcanic Eruption deals damage to each creature and each player equal to the number of Mountains put into a graveyard this way.

rulings.text: Can be used with X equal to zero. This is useful if no Mountains are on the battlefield.

cards.originalText: Destroys X mountains of your choice, and does X damage to each player and each creature in play.

cards.name: Wall of Air
cards.text: Defender, flying (This creature can't attack, and it can block creatures with flying.)
cards.flavor: "This 'standing windstorm' can hold us off indefinitely? Ridiculous!" Saying nothing, she put a pinch of salt on the table. With a bang she clapped her hands, and the salt disappeared, blown away.
cards.originalText: Flying

cards.name: Wall of Water
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{U}: Wall of Water gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: A deafening roar arose as the fury of an enormous vertical river supplanted our serenity. Eddies turned into whirling geysers, leveling everything in their path.
cards.originalText: ooU +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Water Elemental
cards.flavor: Unpredictable as the sea itself, Water Elementals shift without warning from tranquility to tempest. Capricious and fickle, they flow restlessly from one shape to another, expressing their moods with their physical forms.

cards.name: Atraxa, Praetors' Voice
cards.text:
Flying, vigilance, deathtouch, lifelink
At the beginning of your end step, proliferate. (Choose any number of permanents and/or players, then give each another counter of each kind already there.)

rulings.text: As you proliferate, you can choose any players that have counters, including yourself.

You can choose any permanent that has a counter, including ones controlled by opponents. You can’t choose cards in any zone other than the battlefield, even if they have counters on them, such as suspended cards or a Lightning Storm on the stack.

You don’t have to choose every permanent or player that has a counter; you choose only the ones you want to add another counter to. Since “any number” includes zero, you don’t have to choose any permanents at all, and you don’t have to choose any players at all.
If a player or permanent chosen this way has multiple kinds of counters, only a single new counter is given. You choose which kind of counter to give that permanent or player as you proliferate.

Players can respond to the spell or ability whose effect includes proliferating. Once that spell or ability starts to resolve, however, and its controller chooses which permanents and players will get new counters, it’s too late for anyone to respond.

If a creature has +1/+1 counters and -1/-1 counters on it, state-based actions remove the same number of each so that it has only one of those kinds of counters on it. There won’t be any counters of the other kind to put onto it as you proliferate.

cards.name: Atraxa, Praetors' Voice
cards.text:
Flying, vigilance, deathtouch, lifelink
At the beginning of your end step, proliferate. (Choose any number of permanents and/or players, then give each another counter of each kind already there.)

rulings.text: As you proliferate, you can choose any players that have counters, including yourself.

You can choose any permanent that has a counter, including ones controlled by opponents. You can’t choose cards in any zone other than the battlefield, even if they have counters on them, such as suspended cards or a Lightning Storm on the stack.

You don’t have to choose every permanent or player that has a counter; you choose only the ones you want to add another counter to. Since “any number” includes zero, you don’t have to choose any permanents at all, and you don’t have to choose any players at all.
If a player or permanent chosen this way has multiple kinds of counters, only a single new counter is given. You choose which kind of counter to give that permanent or player as you proliferate.

Players can respond to the spell or ability whose effect includes proliferating. Once that spell or ability starts to resolve, however, and its controller chooses which permanents and players will get new counters, it’s too late for anyone to respond.

If a creature has +1/+1 counters and -1/-1 counters on it, state-based actions remove the same number of each so that it has only one of those kinds of counters on it. There won’t be any counters of the other kind to put onto it as you proliferate.

cards.name: Baleful Strix
cards.text:
Flying, deathtouch
When Baleful Strix enters the battlefield, draw a card.
cards.flavor: Its beak rends flesh and bone, exposing the tender marrow of dream.

cards.name: Jace, the Mind Sculptor
cards.text:
[+2]: Look at the top card of target player's library. You may put that card on the bottom of that player's library.
[0]: Draw three cards, then put two cards from your hand on top of your library in any order.
[−1]: Return target creature to its owner's hand.
[−12]: Exile all cards from target player's library, then that player shuffles their hand into their library.

rulings.text: You draw three cards and put two cards back all while Jace’s second ability is resolving. Nothing can happen between the two, and no player may choose to take actions.

If the targeted player for Jace’s last ability has no cards in hand, that player shuffles nothing into their library, and that player’s library will remain empty. That player won’t lose the game until they try to draw from the empty library.

cards.name: Jace, the Mind Sculptor
cards.text:
[+2]: Look at the top card of target player's library. You may put that card on the bottom of that player's library.
[0]: Draw three cards, then put two cards from your hand on top of your library in any order.
[−1]: Return target creature to its owner's hand.
[−12]: Exile all cards from target player's library, then that player shuffles their hand into their library.

rulings.text: You draw three cards and put two cards back all while Jace’s second ability is resolving. Nothing can happen between the two, and no player may choose to take actions.

If the targeted player for Jace’s last ability has no cards in hand, that player shuffles nothing into their library, and that player’s library will remain empty. That player won’t lose the game until they try to draw from the empty library.

cards.name: Thought Reflection
cards.text: If you would draw a card, draw two cards instead.
cards.flavor: Only when two oracles speak in unison is an omen accepted as truth.

rulings.text: Thought Reflection doesn’t cause you to draw cards. Rather, it causes card-drawing effects to have you draw more cards. It also causes the draw action during your draw step to have you draw two cards.

If a spell or ability causes you to draw multiple cards, Thought Reflection’s effect doubles the total number you would draw. For example, if you cast Concentrate (“Draw three cards”), you’ll draw six cards.
The effects of multiple Thought Reflections are cumulative. For example, if you have three Thought Reflections on the battlefield, you’ll draw eight times the original number of cards.
If two or more replacement effects would apply to a card-drawing event, the player who’s drawing the card chooses what order to apply them.

cards.name: Air Elemental
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor: These spirits of the air are winsome and wild, and cannot be truly contained. Only marginally intelligent, they often substitute whimsy for strategy, delighting in mischief and mayhem.

foreignNames.name: Luftelementar
foreignNames.text: Kann fliegen.

cards.originalText: Flying

cards.name: Animate Artifact
cards.text:
Enchant artifact
As long as enchanted artifact isn't a creature, it's an artifact creature with power and toughness each equal to its converted mana cost.

rulings.text: This card has been returned to its original functionality. If it is enchanting an artifact that’s already a creature, it won’t change its power and toughness.

A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn. It doesn’t matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

foreignNames.name: Artefaktbelebung
foreignNames.text: Das verzauberte Nicht-Kreatur-Artefakt wird zu einer Artefaktkreatur mit sowohl Stärke als auch Widerstandskraft in Höhe der Spruchkosten des Artefakts. Es behält allerdings alle seine Originaleigen-schaften.

cards.originalText: Target artifact is now an artifact creature with both power and toughness equal to its casting cost; target retains all its original abilities as well. Has no effect on artifact creatures.

cards.name: Blue Elemental Blast
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Counter target red spell.
• Destroy target red permanent.

rulings.text: The decision to counter a spell or destroy a permanent is a decision made on announcement before the target is selected. If the spell is redirected, this mode can’t be changed, so only targets of the selected type are valid.

foreignNames.name: Blauer Urknall
foreignNames.text: Neutralisiert einen roten Zauberspruch oder zerstört eine rote Karte im Spiel.

cards.originalText: Counters a red spell being cast or destroys a red card in play.

cards.name: Braingeyser
cards.text: Target player draws X cards.

foreignNames.name: Geistesblitz
foreignNames.text: Ein Spieler Deiner Wahl muß X Karten ziehen.

cards.originalText: Target player must draw X cards.

cards.name: Clone
cards.text: You may have Clone enter the battlefield as a copy of any creature on the battlefield.

rulings.text: If the chosen creature is copying something else (for example, if the chosen creature is another Clone), then your Clone enters the battlefield as whatever the chosen creature copied.
If the chosen creature is a token, Clone copies the original characteristics of that token as stated by the effect that put it onto the battlefield. Clone is not a token.

Any enters-the-battlefield abilities of the copied creature will trigger when Clone enters the battlefield. Any “as [this creature] enters the battlefield” or “[this creature] enters the battlefield with” abilities of the chosen creature will also work.
If the chosen creature has {X} in its mana cost (such as Protean Hydra), X is considered to be zero.

Clone copies exactly what was printed on the original creature and nothing more (unless that creature is copying something else or is a token; see below). It doesn’t copy whether that creature is tapped or untapped, whether it has any counters on it or Auras attached to it, or any non-copy effects that have changed its power, toughness, types, color, or so on.
If Clone somehow enters the battlefield at the same time as another creature, Clone can’t become a copy of that creature. You may choose only a creature that’s already on the battlefield.
You can choose not to copy anything. In that case, Clone enters the battlefield as a 0/0 Shapeshifter creature, and is probably put into the graveyard immediately.
Clone’s ability doesn’t target the chosen creature.

foreignNames.name: Klon
foreignNames.text: Der Klon erhält alle Eigenschaften einschließlich der Farbe einer beliebigen im Spiel befindlichen Kreatur. Ein Klon besitzt alle diese Eigenschaften auch dann, wenn das Original vernichtet wird. Ein Klon kann Kreaturen jedes Zauberers kopieren, aber nicht die Verzauberungen, die auf dem Original ruhen. Ohne Kreaturen im Spiel kann ein Klon nicht heraufbeschworen werden.

cards.originalText: Upon summoning, Clone acquires all characteristics, including color, of any one creature in play on either side; any creature enchantments on original creature are not copied. Clone retains these characteristics even after original creature is destroyed. Clone cannot be summoned if there are no creatures in play.

cards.name: Control Magic
cards.text:
Enchant creature
You control enchanted creature.

rulings.text: Gaining control of a creature doesn’t cause you to gain control of any Auras or Equipment attached to it.

foreignNames.name: Kontrollzauber
foreignNames.text: Übernimm die Herrschaft über die verzauberte Kreatur.

cards.originalText: You control target creature until enchantment is discarded or game ends. If target creature is already tapped it stays tapped until you can untap it. If destroyed, target creature is put in its owner's graveyard.

cards.name: Copy Artifact
cards.text: You may have Copy Artifact enter the battlefield as a copy of any artifact on the battlefield, except it's an enchantment in addition to its other types.

rulings.text: The copy is both an artifact and an enchantment, so it is an artifact-enchantment (perhaps even an artifact-creature-enchantment). It can be affected by anything which affects either type of permanent.
The copy of the artifact is not still blue. It copies the color of the thing it is copying.
The artifact to copy is chosen at the time this card enters the battlefield. If there is no valid artifact to choose, then this card enters the battlefield as an enchantment that has no effect.

foreignNames.name: Artefaktduplikat
foreignNames.text: Wähle ein beliebiges Artefakt im Spiel aus. Dieser Zauber erschafft eine Kopie dieses Artefakts; das Duplikat wird sowohl von Sprüchen, die für Verzauberungen gelten, als auch von Sprüchen, die für Artefakte gelten, betroffen. Das Duplikat überdauert auch den Tod des Originalartefakts. Verzauberungen, die auf das Originalartefakt gesprochen wurden, werden nicht mitkopiert.

cards.originalText: Select any artifact in play. This enchantment acts as a duplicate of that artifact; it is affected by cards that affect either enchantments or artifacts. The copy remains even if the original artifact is destroyed. Enchantments on the original artifact are not copied.

cards.name: Counterspell
cards.text: Counter target spell.

foreignNames.name: Gegenzauber
foreignNames.text: Neutralisiere einen gerade gespielten Zauberspruch.

cards.originalText: Counters target spell as it is being cast.

cards.name: Creature Bond
cards.text:
Enchant creature
When enchanted creature dies, Creature Bond deals damage equal to that creature's toughness to the creature's controller.

foreignNames.name: Kreaturenbindung
foreignNames.text: Wenn das verzauberte Wesen auf dem Friedhof landet, fügt es durch die Bindung seinem Beherrscher Schaden in Höhe seiner Widerstandskraft zu.

cards.originalText: If target creature is placed in the graveyard, Creature Bond does an amount of damage equal to creature's toughness to creature's controller.

cards.name: Drain Power
cards.text: Target player activates a mana ability of each land they control. Then that player loses all unspent mana and you add the mana lost this way.

rulings.text: This card forces the target player to draw mana from lands if they are untapped, but that player can choose how to draw the mana if a land they control has multiple mana abilities, or mana abilities with choices.
Your opponent may use instants and abilities of permanents in response to this spell before you get the mana from their mana pool and lands.
If a land can draw a variable amount of mana, the target player (not the player of this spell) chooses how much to draw.
A mana ability is an ability that (1) isn’t a loyalty ability, (2) doesn’t target, and (3) could put mana into a player’s mana pool when it resolves.

foreignNames.name: Kraftsog
foreignNames.text: Dein Gegner muß alles Mana aus seinem verfügbaren Ländern produzieren. Dieses Mana und alles Mana, das er in seinem Manavorrat hat, fließt nun in Deinen Manavorrat.

cards.originalText: Opponent must draw all mana from his or her available lands; this mana and all mana in opponent's mana pool drains into your mana pool. You can't take less than all your opponent's mana.

cards.name: Energy Flux
cards.text: All artifacts have "At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice this artifact unless you pay {2}."

foreignNames.name: Energiefluktuation
foreignNames.text: Jeder Spieler muß während seiner Versorgungsphase aller Artefakte, die er beherrscht, zerstören. Der Spieler kann dies umgehen, indem er für alle Artefakte, die er retten möchte, jeweils 2 bezahlt.

cards.originalText: All artifacts in play now require an upkeep cost of o2 in addition to any other upkeep costs they may have. If the upkeep cost for an artifact is not paid, the artifact must be discarded.

cards.name: Feedback
cards.text:
Enchant enchantment
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted enchantment's controller, Feedback deals 1 damage to that player.

foreignNames.name: Rückkopplung
foreignNames.text: Während der Versorgungsphase des Beherrschers der verzauberten Verzauberung fügt ihm die Rückkopplung 1 Schadenspunkt zu.

cards.originalText: Feedback does 1 damage to controller of target enchantment during its controller's upkeep.

cards.name: Flight
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has flying.

foreignNames.name: Flugfähigkeit
foreignNames.text: Die verzauberte Kreatur kann jetzt fliegen.

cards.originalText: Target creature is now a flying creature.

cards.name: Hurkyl's Recall
cards.text: Return all artifacts target player owns to their hand.
cards.flavor: This spell, like many attributed to Drafna, was actually the work of his wife Hurkyl.

rulings.text: Retrieves all artifacts owned by the target player regardless of who controls them. Ignores artifacts owned by other players even if target player has control of them.
It only returns artifacts which are on the battlefield.

foreignNames.name: Hurkyls Erinnerung
foreignNames.text: Der Spieler, gegen den dieser Spruch gespielt wird, muß alle seine im Spiel befindlichen Artefakte zurück auf seine Hand nehmen.

cards.originalText: All artifacts in play owned by target player are returned to target player's hand. Any enchantments on those artifacts are discarded.

cards.name: Island Fish Jasconius
cards.text:
Island Fish Jasconius doesn't untap during your untap step.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may pay {U}{U}{U}. If you do, untap Island Fish Jasconius.
Island Fish Jasconius can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.
When you control no Islands, sacrifice Island Fish Jasconius.

rulings.text: Reworded so that it triggers only once at beginning of upkeep, instead of being an activated ability usable any time during your upkeep. You can no longer make infinite combos with this ability.

foreignNames.name: Inselfisch Jasconius
foreignNames.text:
Der Inselfisch enttappt nicht während Deiner Enttap-Phase.
Der Inselfisch kann nur angreifen, wenn der Gegner Inseln im Spiel hat. Wenn Du zu irgendeiner Zeit keine Inseln mehr im Spiel hast, geht Jasconius direkt auf den Friedhof.
{U}{U}{U}: Enttappe Inselfisch. Du kannst diese Eigenschaft nur während Deiner Versorgungsphase benutzen.

cards.originalText: You must pay oUoUoU during your upkeep phase to untap Island Fish. Island Fish cannot attack unless opponent has islands in play. Island Fish is destroyed immediately if at any time you have no islands in play.

cards.name: Jump
cards.text: Target creature gains flying until end of turn.

rulings.text: To work as an evasion ability, an attacking creature must already have flying when the declare blockers step begins. Once a creature has become blocked, giving it flying won’t change that.

foreignNames.name: Sprung
foreignNames.text: Die Zielkreatur kann bis zum Ende des Zuges fliegen.

cards.originalText: Target creature is a flying creature until end of turn.

cards.name: Lifetap
cards.text: Whenever a Forest an opponent controls becomes tapped, you gain 1 life.

rulings.text: Gives one life for each and every Forest tapped.
In multi-player games it affects all opponents.

foreignNames.name: Lebenszeichen
foreignNames.text: Für jeden Wald Deines Gegners, der getappt wird, erhältst Du 1 Lebenspunkt.

cards.originalText: You gain 1 life each time any forest of opponent's becomes tapped.

cards.name: Lord of Atlantis
cards.text: Other Merfolk get +1/+1 and have islandwalk. (They can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)
cards.flavor: A master of tactics, the Lord of Atlantis makes his people bold in battle merely by arriving to lead them.

foreignNames.name: Lord von Atlantis
foreignNames.text: Alles Meervolk erhält +1/+1 und die Fähigkeit Inseltarnung.

cards.originalText: All Merfolk in play gain islandwalk and +1/+1 while this card is in play.

cards.name: Magical Hack
cards.text: Change the text of target spell or permanent by replacing all instances of one basic land type with another. (For example, you may change "swampwalk" to "plainswalk." This effect lasts indefinitely.)

rulings.text: Alters all occurrences of the chosen word in the text box and the type line of the given card.
Can target a card with no appropriate words on it, or even one with no words at all.
It can’t change a word to the same word. It must be a different word.
It only changes what is printed on the card (or set on a token when it was created or set by a copy effect). It will not change any effects that are on the permanent.
You choose the words to change on resolution.
You can’t change proper nouns (i.e. card names) such as “Island Fish Jasconius”.

Changing the text of a spell will not allow you to change the targets of the spell because the targets were chosen when the spell was cast. The text change will (probably) cause it to be countered since the targets will be illegal.
If you change the text of a spell which is to become a permanent, the permanent will retain the text change until the effect wears off.
It can be used to change a land’s type from one basic land type to another. For example, Forest can be changed to Island so it produces blue mana. It doesn’t change the name of any permanent.

foreignNames.name: Kupferstecher
foreignNames.text: Ändere den Text einer Karte Deiner Wahl, die gerade gespielt wird oder bereits im Spiel ist, indem Du ein Basisland durch ein beliebiges anderes ersetzt. Du kannst so zum Beispiel "Sumpftarnung" durch "Ebenentarnung" ersetzen.

cards.originalText: Change the text of any card being played or already in play by replacing one basic land type with another. For example, you can change "swampwalk" to "plainswalk."

cards.name: Mahamoti Djinn
cards.text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
cards.flavor: Of royal blood among the spirits of the air, the Mahamoti Djinn rides on the wings of the winds. As dangerous in the gambling hall as he is in battle, he is a master of trickery and misdirection.

foreignNames.name: Mahamoti-Dschinn
foreignNames.text: Kann fliegen.

cards.originalText: Flying

cards.name: Mana Short
cards.text: Tap all lands target player controls and that player loses all unspent mana.

rulings.text: It even taps lands that do not produce mana.

Since this is an instant, your opponent may use instants in response to the casting of this spell. Note that such spells and abilities will be resolved before the mana pool is emptied by the Mana Short. This makes it useless as a countermeasure for spells. To use it effectively, you need to use it during Upkeep and even then it will not prevent the use of instant spells and abilities.
If you play Mana Short in response to a spell, it will have no effect on that spell since the mana has already been paid.

foreignNames.name: Manamangel
foreignNames.text: Alle Gelände des Gegners werden getappt und sein Manavorrat geleert.

cards.originalText: All opponent's lands are tapped, and opponent's mana pool is emptied. Opponent takes no damage from unspent mana.

cards.name: Merfolk of the Pearl Trident
cards.flavor: Most human scholars believe that Merfolk are the survivors of sunken Atlantis, humans adapted to the water. Merfolk, however, believe that humans sprang forth from Merfolk who adapted themselves in order to explore their last frontier.

cards.name: Phantasmal Forces
cards.text:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Phantasmal Forces unless you pay {U}.
cards.flavor: These beings embody the essence of true heroes long dead. Summoned from the dreamrealms, they rise to meet their enemies.

foreignNames.name: Traumkrieger
foreignNames.text:
Können fliegen.
Zahle während Deiner Versorgungsphase {U} oder zerstöre die Traumkrieger.

cards.originalText:
Flying
Controller must spend oU during upkeep to maintain or Phantasmal Forces are destroyed.

cards.name: Phantasmal Terrain
cards.text:
Enchant land
As Phantasmal Terrain enters the battlefield, choose a basic land type.
Enchanted land is the chosen type.

rulings.text: Will not add or remove Snow Supertype to or from a land.

foreignNames.name: Reich der Illusionen
foreignNames.text: Verzaubere ein Land in ein Standardland Deiner Wahl.

cards.originalText: Target land changes to any basic land type of caster's choice. Land type is set when cast and may not be further altered by this card.

cards.name: Phantom Monster
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor: "While, like a ghastly rapid river, Through the pale door, A hideous throng rush out forever, And laugh—but smile no more." —Edgar Allan Poe, "The Haunted Palace"

foreignNames.name: Phantommonster
foreignNames.text: Kann fliegen.

cards.originalText: Flying

cards.name: Pirate Ship
cards.text:
Pirate Ship can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.
{T}: Pirate Ship deals 1 damage to any target.
When you control no Islands, sacrifice Pirate Ship.

foreignNames.name: Piratenschiff
foreignNames.text:
Das Piratenschiff kann nur angreifen, wenn der Gegner Inseln im Spiel hat. Wenn Du zu irgendeiner Zeit keine Inseln mehr im Spiel hast, begrabe das Piratenschiff.
{T}: Füge einem beliebigen Ziel 1 Schadenspunkt zu.

cards.originalText:
ocT: Do 1 damage to any target.
Cannot attack unless opponent has islands in play, though controller may still use special ability. Pirate Ship is destroyed immediately if at any time controller has no islands in play.

cards.name: Power Leak
cards.text:
Enchant enchantment
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted enchantment's controller, that player may pay any amount of mana. Power Leak deals 2 damage to that player. Prevent X of that damage, where X is the amount of mana that player paid this way.

foreignNames.name: Kraftleck
foreignNames.text: Während der Versorgungsphase des Beherrschers der verzauberten Verzauberung fügt das Kraftleck diesem 2 Schadenspunkte zu. Dieser Spieler kann 1 pro Schadenspunkt, den er vermeiden will, ausgeben, um sich vor dem Kraftleck zu schützen.

cards.originalText: Target enchantment costs 2 extra mana during the upkeep phase of each of its controller's turns. If target enchantment's controller cannot or will not pay this extra mana, Power Leak does 1 damage to him or her for each unpaid mana.

cards.name: Power Sink
cards.text: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {X}. If that player doesn't, they tap all lands with mana abilities they control and lose all unspent mana.

rulings.text: Does not increase the mana cost of the spell. It just requires a separate expenditure in order for it to succeed.

When this spell resolves, you either pay X mana or let your lands become tapped. The lands that become tapped are not “tapped for mana”. If you choose to pay, you may pay the X mana using whatever mana abilities you want to use.

Only lands that actually have mana abilities will get tapped. This includes basic lands and lands with mana abilities printed on them, as well as lands which have been granted a mana ability by some effect.

foreignNames.name: Kraftverlust
foreignNames.text: Der Zielspruch wird neutralisiert, wenn dessen Urheber nicht sofort X ausgibt. Er muß alles verfügbare Mana aus seinem Manavorrat und seinen Ländern ausgeben, bis X bezahlt ist; wenn benötigt, kann er auch andere Manaquellen heranziehen.

cards.originalText: Target spell is countered unless its caster spends X more mana. Caster of target spell must draw and spend all available mana from lands and mana pool until X is spent; he or she may also spend mana from other sources if desired. If this is not enough mana, target spell will still be countered.

cards.name: Prodigal Sorcerer
cards.text: {T}: Prodigal Sorcerer deals 1 damage to any target.
cards.flavor: Occasionally a member of the Institute of Arcane Study acquires a taste for worldly pleasures. Seldom do they have trouble finding employment.

foreignNames.name: Abtrünniger Zauberer
foreignNames.text: {T}: Fügt einem beliebigen Ziel 1 Schadenspunkt zu.

cards.originalText: ocT: Do 1 damage to any target.

cards.name: Psychic Venom
cards.text:
Enchant land
Whenever enchanted land becomes tapped, Psychic Venom deals 2 damage to that land's controller.

rulings.text: Whenever the land is tapped for any reason, the ability triggers.

foreignNames.name: Seelengift
foreignNames.text: Wenn das verzauberte Land getappt wird, fügt das Seelengift dessen Beherrscher 2 Schadenspunkte zu.

cards.originalText: Whenever target land becomes tapped, Psychic Venom does 2 damage to target land's controller.

cards.name: Reconstruction
cards.text: Return target artifact card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: Tedious research made the Sages of the College of Lat-Nam adept in repairing broken artifacts.

foreignNames.name: Wiederherstellung
foreignNames.text: Hole ein Artefakt vom Friedhof zurück in Dein Blatt.

cards.originalText: Bring one artifact from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Sea Serpent
cards.text:
Sea Serpent can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.
When you control no Islands, sacrifice Sea Serpent.
cards.flavor: Legend has it that Serpents used to be bigger, but how could that be?

foreignNames.name: Seeschlange
foreignNames.text: Die Schlange kann nur angreifen, wenn der Gegner Inseln im Spiel hat. Wenn Du zu irgendeiner Zeit keine Inseln mehr im Spiel hast, geht die Schlange direkt auf den Friedhof.

cards.originalText: Serpent cannot attack unless opponent has islands in play. Serpent is buried immediately if at any time controller has no islands in play.

cards.name: Serendib Efreet
cards.text:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, Serendib Efreet deals 1 damage to you.

foreignNames.name: Serendib-Ifrit
foreignNames.text:
Kann fliegen.
Der Ifrit fügt Dir während Deiner Versorgungsphase 1 Schadenspunkt zu.

cards.originalText:
Flying
Serendib Efreet does 1 damage to you during your upkeep.

cards.name: Siren's Call
cards.text:
Cast this spell only during an opponent's turn, before attackers are declared.
Creatures the active player controls attack this turn if able.
At the beginning of the next end step, destroy all non-Wall creatures that player controls that didn't attack this turn. Ignore this effect for each creature the player didn't control continuously since the beginning of the turn.

rulings.text: It will require creatures with Haste to attack since they are able, but it won’t destroy them if they don’t for some reason.
The creature is destroyed if it does not attack because it simply can’t do so legally.
This will destroy creatures that weren’t able to attack because they had been previously tapped.
If a turn has multiple combat phases, this spell can only be cast before the beginning of the Declare Attackers Step of the first combat phase in that turn.

foreignNames.name: Lockruf der Sirenen
foreignNames.text: Sämtliche Kreaturen des Gegners, die angreifen könnten, müssen angreifen. Alle Kreaturen, die es nicht tun und keine Mauern sind, werden am Ende der Spielrunde vernichtet. Dieser Spontanzauber kann nur gespielt werden, wenn der Gegner am Ende des Zuges ist, und nur vor seiner Angriffsphase. Kreaturen, die während dieser Runde heraufbeschworen wurden, bleiben vom Lockruf der Sirenen verschont.

cards.originalText: All of opponent's creatures that can attack must do so. Any non-wall creatures that cannot attack are killed at end of turn. Can be played only during opponent's turn, before opponent's attack. Creatures summoned this turn are unaffected by Siren's Call.

cards.name: Sleight of Mind
cards.text: Change the text of target spell or permanent by replacing all instances of one color word with another. (For example, you may change "target black spell" to "target blue spell." This effect lasts indefinitely.)

rulings.text: You can’t Sleight proper nouns (i.e. card names). This means that you can’t affect a “Black Vise”.
Can target a card with no color words on it.
Can’t change a color word to the same color word. It must be a different word.
Alters all occurrences of the chosen word in the text box and the type line of the given card.
Can target a card with no appropriate words on it, or even one with no words at all.
It can’t change a word to the same word. It must be a different word.
It only changes what is printed on the card (or set on a token when it was created or set by a copy effect). It will not change any effects that are on the permanent.
You choose the words to change on resolution.

Changing the text of a spell will not allow you to change the targets of the spell because the targets were chosen when the spell was cast. The text change will (probably) cause it to be countered since the targets will be illegal.
If you change the text of a spell which is to become a permanent, the permanent will retain the text change until the effect wears off.

foreignNames.name: Geniestreich
foreignNames.text: Ändere den Text eines Zielspruchs oder einer bleibenden Karte Deiner Wahl, indem Du eine Farbe durch eine andere ersetzt. Du kannst so z.B. "Neutralisiert roten Zauberspruch" durch "Neutralisiert schwarzen Zauberspruch" ersetzen. Die Manasymbole können durch den Geniestreich allerdings nicht vertauscht werden.

cards.originalText: Change the text of any card being played or already in play by replacing one color word with another. For example, you can change "Counters red spells" to "Counters black spells." Sleight of Mind cannot change mana symbols.

cards.name: Spell Blast
cards.text: Counter target spell with converted mana cost X. (For example, if that spell's mana cost is {3}{U}{U}, X is 5.)

rulings.text: Alternative costs, additional costs, cost increases, and cost reductions don’t affect a spell’s converted mana cost.

If the target spell has {X} in its mana cost, include the value chosen for that X when determining the value of the {X} in Spell Blast’s mana cost. For example, if you wish to counter Volcanic Geyser (a spell with mana cost {X}{R}{R}) whose X is 7, you’ll need to choose 9 for Spell Blast’s X and pay {9}{U}.

foreignNames.name: Zauberspruchexplosion
foreignNames.text: Der Zielzauber wird abgewehrt, wobei X für die Kosten des Zielzaubers steht.

cards.originalText: Target spell is countered; X is casting cost of target spell.

cards.name: Stasis
cards.text:
Players skip their untap steps.
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Stasis unless you pay {U}.

rulings.text: Since there is no untap step, Phasing in/out won’t happen.
Does not prevent cards from being untapped outside the untap step.

foreignNames.name: Starre
foreignNames.text: Alle Spieler erhalten keine Enttap-Phase mehr. Bezahle {U} während Deiner Versorgungsphase oder vernichte die Starre.

cards.originalText: Players do not get an untap phase. Pay oU during your upkeep or Stasis is destroyed; cards still do not untap until the next untap phase.

cards.name: Steal Artifact
cards.text:
Enchant artifact
You control enchanted artifact.

rulings.text: Can be used on artifact creatures.

foreignNames.name: Artefaktdiebstahl
foreignNames.text: Übernimm die Herrschaft über das verzauberte Artefakt.

cards.originalText: You control target artifact until enchantment is discarded or game ends. If target artifact was tapped when stolen, it stays tapped until you can untap it. If destroyed, target artifact is put in its owner's graveyard.

cards.name: Thoughtlace
cards.text: Target spell or permanent becomes blue. (Mana symbols on that permanent remain unchanged.)

foreignNames.name: Gedankengewebe
foreignNames.text: Die Farbe einer entweder im Spiel befindlichen oder gerade gespielten Karte verändert sich in Blau. Völlig unberührt davon bleiben der Gebrauch einer bestimmten Fähigkeit und die Kosten der Heraufbeschwörung, des Tappens oder der Versorgung der veränderten Karte.

cards.originalText: Changes the color of one card either being played or already in play to blue. Cost to cast, tap, maintain, or use a special ability of target card remains entirely unchanged.

cards.name: Unstable Mutation
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +3/+3.
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted creature's controller, put a -1/-1 counter on that creature.

rulings.text: The -1/-1 counters stay even if the Aura is removed, and the +3/+3 goes away when the Aura does.

foreignNames.name: Instabile Mutation
foreignNames.text: Die verzauberte Kreatur erhält +3/+3. Während der Versorgungsphase ihres Beherrschers wird ein -1/-1 Spielstein auf die Kreatur gelegt. Diese Spielsteine bleiben auch dann im Spiel, wenn die Mutation entfernt wird.

cards.originalText: Target creature gains +3/+3. During the upkeep phase of each of its controller's turns, put a -1/-1 counter on the creature. These counters remain even if this enchantment is removed before the creature dies.

cards.name: Unsummon
cards.text: Return target creature to its owner's hand.

foreignNames.name: Rückruf
foreignNames.text: Bringe eine Kreatur auf die Hand ihres Besitzers zurück.

cards.originalText: Return target creature to owner's hand; enchantments on target creature are discarded.

cards.name: Vesuvan Doppelganger
cards.text: You may have Vesuvan Doppelganger enter the battlefield as a copy of any creature on the battlefield, except it doesn't copy that creature's color and it has "At the beginning of your upkeep, you may have this creature become a copy of target creature, except it doesn't copy that creature's color and it has this ability."

rulings.text: When the Doppelganger switches creatures, the creature it used to be is not considered to have left the battlefield. Such effects will consider the creature to have left the battlefield when the Doppelganger leaves the battlefield.
Damage is not removed when it changes forms.
Can switch to the same creature it is currently a copy of.
When it takes on the characteristics of the other card, it is no longer of creature type Shapeshifter.
When changing forms, any text changes that exist on the Doppelganger are applied to the new text, if appropriate.

If a Doppelganger is flipped, and it copies a flip card in any state, it will copy both “sides” of that card but use the flipped side. If a Doppelganger is unflipped, and it copies a flip card in any state, it will copy both “sides” of that card but use the unflipped side. In the second case, if it ever meets the flip conditions of its new ability, it will flip and used the flipped side of what it is copying.
Although Vesuvan Doppelganger’s triggered ability is targeted, its “as enters the battlefield” ability is not.
When Vesuvan Doppelganger’s triggered ability triggers, you must choose a target for it. You determine whether to have the Doppelganger become a copy of that target when the ability resolves.
Vesuvan Doppelganger copies the mana cost of the creature it’s copying but doesn’t copy its color.

If another creature copies Vesuvan Doppelganger, the new creature will become a copy of whatever Vesuvan Doppelganger is copying except for its color, will copy Vesuvan Doppelganger’s color, and will gain Vesuvan Doppelganger’s triggered ability.

Vesuvan Doppelganger’s triggered ability may cause it to become a copy of itself. A Vesuvan Doppelganger that becomes a copy of a Vesuvan Doppelganger (either itself or a different one) will gain another instance of its triggered ability. Each instance of that ability will trigger during its controller’s upkeep. They’ll all be put on the stack and resolve one at a time. The last one to resolve determines the Doppelganger’s characteristics for the rest of the turn.
Vesuvan Doppelganger copies a face-down creature, it becomes a face-up 2/2 blue creature with no name and no abilities other than the one it gives itself.

foreignNames.name: Vesuvischer Doppelgänger
foreignNames.text: Der Doppelgänger nimmt alle Charakteristika irgendeiner Kreatur eines beliebigen Spielers anaußer der Farbe. Jegliche Verzauberungen auf der Originalkreatur werden nicht mitkopiert. Während der Versorgungsphase des Beherrschers kann der Doppelgänger sich in eine andere, sich im Spiel befindliche Kreatur verwandeln und deren Eigenschaften annehmen. Ein Doppelgänger kann seine neue Form auch dann beibehalten, wenn diese Kreatur das Spiel verlassen sollte.

cards.originalText: Upon summoning, Doppelganger acquires all characteristics except color of any one creature in play on either side; any creature enchantments on the original creature are not copied. During controller's upkeep, Doppelganger may take on the characteristics of a different creature in play instead. Doppelganger may continue to copy a creature even after that creature leaves play, but if it switches it won't be able to switch back.

cards.name: Volcanic Eruption
cards.text: Destroy X target Mountains. Volcanic Eruption deals damage to each creature and each player equal to the number of Mountains put into a graveyard this way.

rulings.text: Can be used with X equal to zero. This is useful if no Mountains are on the battlefield.

foreignNames.name: Vulkanausbruch
foreignNames.text: Zerstöre X Gebirge Deiner Wahl. Der Vulkanausbruch fügt jedem Spieler und jeder Kreatur für jedes so vernichtete Gebirge einen Schadenspunkt zu.

cards.originalText: Destroys X mountains of your choice, and does 1 damage to each player and each creature in play for each mountain destroyed.

cards.name: Wall of Air
cards.text: Defender, flying (This creature can't attack, and it can block creatures with flying.)
cards.flavor: "This 'standing windstorm' can hold us off indefinitely? Ridiculous!" Saying nothing, she put a pinch of salt on the table. With a bang she clapped her hands, and the salt disappeared, blown away.

foreignNames.name: Luftmauer
foreignNames.text: Kann fliegen.

cards.originalText: Flying

cards.name: Wall of Water
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{U}: Wall of Water gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: A deafening roar arose as the fury of an enormous vertical river supplanted our serenity. Eddies turned into whirling geysers, leveling everything in their path.

foreignNames.name: Wasserwand
foreignNames.text: {U}: +1/+0 bis zum Ende des Zuges.

cards.name: Water Elemental
cards.flavor: Unpredictable as the sea itself, Water Elementals shift without warning from tranquility to tempest. Capricious and fickle, they flow restlessly from one shape to another, expressing their moods with their physical forms.

cards.name: Air Elemental
cards.text: Flying

cards.name: Animate Artifact
cards.text:
Enchant artifact
As long as enchanted artifact isn't a creature, it's an artifact creature with power and toughness each equal to its converted mana cost.

rulings.text: This card has been returned to its original functionality. If it is enchanting an artifact that’s already a creature, it won’t change its power and toughness.

A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn. It doesn’t matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

cards.name: Backfire
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature deals damage to you, Backfire deals that much damage to that creature's controller.

cards.name: Blue Elemental Blast
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Counter target red spell.
• Destroy target red permanent.

rulings.text: The decision to counter a spell or destroy a permanent is a decision made on announcement before the target is selected. If the spell is redirected, this mode can’t be changed, so only targets of the selected type are valid.

cards.name: Control Magic
cards.text:
Enchant creature
You control enchanted creature.

rulings.text: Gaining control of a creature doesn’t cause you to gain control of any Auras or Equipment attached to it.

cards.name: Counterspell
cards.text: Counter target spell.

cards.name: Creature Bond
cards.text:
Enchant creature
When enchanted creature dies, Creature Bond deals damage equal to that creature's toughness to the creature's controller.

cards.name: Drain Power
cards.text: Target player activates a mana ability of each land they control. Then that player loses all unspent mana and you add the mana lost this way.

rulings.text: This card forces the target player to draw mana from lands if they are untapped, but that player can choose how to draw the mana if a land they control has multiple mana abilities, or mana abilities with choices.
Your opponent may use instants and abilities of permanents in response to this spell before you get the mana from their mana pool and lands.
If a land can draw a variable amount of mana, the target player (not the player of this spell) chooses how much to draw.
A mana ability is an ability that (1) isn’t a loyalty ability, (2) doesn’t target, and (3) could put mana into a player’s mana pool when it resolves.

cards.name: Energy Flux
cards.text: All artifacts have "At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice this artifact unless you pay {2}."

cards.name: Energy Tap
cards.text: Tap target untapped creature you control. If you do, add an amount of {C} equal to that creature's converted mana cost.

cards.name: Erosion
cards.text:
Enchant land
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted land's controller, destroy that land unless that player pays {1} or 1 life.

cards.name: Feedback
cards.text:
Enchant enchantment
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted enchantment's controller, Feedback deals 1 damage to that player.

cards.name: Flight
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has flying.

cards.name: Flood
cards.text: {U}{U}: Tap target creature without flying.

cards.name: Gaseous Form
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to and dealt by enchanted creature.

rulings.text: The enchanted creature can still attack and block.

cards.name: Ghost Ship
cards.text:
Flying
{U}{U}{U}: Regenerate Ghost Ship.

cards.name: Giant Tortoise
cards.text: Giant Tortoise gets +0/+3 as long as it's untapped.
